verbose_text: Based on these results, we hypothesized that infection with Listeria monocytogenes (Lm), a bacterial pathogen that can strongly activate NLRP3 via its listeriolysin toxin, AIM2, by release of genomic DNA, and weakly activate the NLRC4 pathway because of downregulation of flagellin expression, should also cause loss of UBE2L3.
